metadata.title: CVE-2017-9334 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An incorrect "pair?" check in the Scheme "length" procedure results in anunsafe pointer dereference in all CHICKEN Scheme versions prior to 4.13,which allows an attacker to cause a denial of service by passing animproper list to an application that calls "length" on it.

criterions.comment: chicken: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
